extraExplanation: “disruptive”来自动词“disrupt”（打乱、扰乱）。“dis-”有“分开、使不…”的含义，“rupt”与“break”（破裂）相关，所以整体感觉是“把原本连续的东西打断”。
在校园语境里，“a disruptive student/behavior”通常指“扰乱课堂秩序”，语气较正式；日常也可用“annoying”（烦人的）但语义更弱。
在商业里，“disruptive”常带中性甚至偏褒义，强调“改变行业规则”；而在课堂/公共秩序里多为贬义，表示“添乱、影响他人”。

summary.en: “Disruptively” means “in a way that interrupts or causes disorder,” and in business it can mean “in a game-changing, disruptive-innovation way.”
summary.zh: “disruptively”表示“以打断、扰乱的方式”；在商业语境中也可表示“以颠覆性创新方式带来重大改变”。

definition.en: In a way that causes interruption, disorder, or prevents something from continuing normally.
definition.zh: 以打断、扰乱或使事情无法正常进行的方式；破坏性地。

examples.en: The student spoke disruptively during the lecture.
examples.zh: 那位学生在讲座中以干扰性的方式讲话。

examples.en: Construction noise can disruptively affect nearby residents’ sleep.
examples.zh: 施工噪音可能会以扰乱性的方式影响附近居民的睡眠。

definition.en: (Business/technology) In a way that introduces a major change that replaces older methods or products.
definition.zh: （商业/科技）以颠覆性方式；通过重大创新改变并取代旧的做法或产品。

examples.en: Online streaming changed the music industry disruptively.
examples.zh: 网络流媒体以颠覆性的方式改变了音乐行业。

examples.en: The company aims to innovate disruptively, not just improve small features.
examples.zh: 这家公司目标是做颠覆式创新，而不只是改进一些小功能。

extraExplanation: 在日常语境里，disruptively 多指“制造干扰、扰乱秩序”（如课堂、会议、交通）。在商业语境里，它常与 innovation（创新）搭配，disruptive/disruptively 更偏正面或中性，表示“颠覆性改变”，不一定带有“捣乱”的负面评价。
词形提示：disrupt（动词：打乱）→ disruptive（形容词：扰乱性的/颠覆性的）→ disruptively（副词）。常见搭配：behave/speak/act disruptively；innovate disruptively。

summary.en: Disruptiveness means the quality of causing disruption; in business it can also mean the ability to “disrupt” an industry.
summary.zh: Disruptiveness 指“造成干扰/扰乱”的性质或程度；在商业语境中也可指“颠覆行业”的能力或潜力。

definition.en: the tendency or quality of causing disruption (interrupting, disturbing, or stopping normal activity)
definition.zh: “造成干扰/扰乱”的倾向或性质（打断、搅乱或使正常活动无法顺利进行）

examples.en: The teacher addressed the disruptiveness of side conversations during the lesson.
examples.zh: 老师处理了上课时同学私下聊天带来的干扰问题。

examples.en: His constant phone notifications added to the disruptiveness of the meeting.
examples.zh: 他手机不断响起的通知让会议更难顺利进行。

definition.en: (business/technology) the power or potential to change an industry by breaking existing patterns, often through a new product or model
definition.zh: （商业/科技）“颠覆性”的力量或潜力：通过新产品或新模式打破旧规则、改变行业运作方式

examples.en: Investors talked about the disruptiveness of the startup’s low-cost service.
examples.zh: 投资人讨论了这家初创公司低成本服务的颠覆潜力。

examples.en: The report compared the disruptiveness of different AI tools in education.
examples.zh: 报告比较了不同 AI 工具在教育领域的颠覆程度。

extraExplanation: “disruptiveness”常见于两种语境：一是日常/教育场景里的“捣乱、干扰性”；二是商业语境里的“颠覆性（disruptive innovation）”。注意商业语境常带中性或偏褒义色彩，而日常语境多偏负面。
构词：disrupt（打乱、扰乱）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ disruptive（造成干扰的/颠覆性的）+ -ness（名词后缀）→ disruptiveness（这种性质/程度）。

summary.en: “Disruptment” is a rare/nonstandard noun meaning interruption or disturbance; the standard word is “disruption.”
summary.zh: “disruptment”是少见/不规范的名词，表示“中断、扰乱”；标准用法通常是“disruption”。

definition.en: (Nonstandard/rare) The act of disrupting something; interruption or disturbance. In modern English, people almost always use “disruption.”
definition.zh: （非标准/少见）指“扰乱、打断”的行为或结果；中断、干扰。现代英语中通常用“disruption”。

examples.en: The storm caused major disruption to flights.
examples.zh: 暴风雨导致航班严重中断。

examples.en: New rules may create disruption in the workplace at first.
examples.zh: 新规定一开始可能会在工作场所造成一些混乱/干扰。

extraExplanation: “disruptment”在主流词典与正式写作中非常少见，很多情况下会被认为是不自然或不规范的用词。更常见、最推荐的名词形式是“disruption”。
构词提示：动词“disrupt”（扰乱、打断）→ 常用名词“disruption”（扰乱/中断）。在学术、新闻、商务语境中几乎都用“disruption”。如果你想表达“造成干扰”，也常用短语“cause disruption”或“lead to disruption”。

summary.en: A disruptor is usually an innovator that changes an industry, or more generally anything that interrupts normal progress.
summary.zh: disruptor通常指用创新改变行业的“颠覆者”，也可泛指打断正常进程的“干扰/破坏因素”。

definition.en: A person or company that introduces a new idea, product, or way of doing things that changes an industry or social system, often challenging established leaders.
definition.zh: （尤指商业或社会领域的）颠覆者；通过新想法/新产品/新方式改变行业或体系、挑战既有强者的人或公司。

examples.en: Many people call streaming services disruptors because they changed how we watch movies.
examples.zh: 很多人把流媒体平台称为“颠覆者”，因为它们改变了我们看电影的方式。

examples.en: The startup positioned itself as a disruptor in online education.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司把自己定位为在线教育领域的颠覆者。

definition.en: A person or thing that interrupts or prevents a process, event, or system from continuing normally.
definition.zh: 破坏者；干扰者；使过程、活动或系统无法正常进行的人或事物。

examples.en: Bad weather can be a major disruptor of travel plans.
examples.zh: 恶劣天气会严重干扰出行计划。

examples.en: Loud noises were disruptors during the exam.
examples.zh: 考试时的噪音是干扰因素。

extraExplanation: “disruptor”在当代英语里最常见于商业与科技语境（如“industry disruptor”行业颠覆者）。它带有一定褒义或中性色彩，强调“创新带来的改变”；而“disruptor of an event/process”更偏向负面，强调“打断/扰乱”。可与动词“disrupt”（扰乱、使中断）联系记忆。

summary.en: “Disrupts” means causes something to stop running normally or creates disorder.
summary.zh: “disrupts”表示扰乱某事的正常进行，使其不顺或造成混乱。

definition.en: to interrupt or break the normal course of something, causing disorder or delay
definition.zh: 打乱；扰乱（某事的正常进行），导致混乱或延误

examples.en: The storm disrupts flights every winter.
examples.zh: 每年冬天暴风雨都会扰乱航班。

examples.en: One small mistake can disrupt the whole plan.
examples.zh: 一个小错误就可能打乱整个计划。

definition.en: to prevent someone or a system from continuing normally; to stop something from working as intended
definition.zh: 使（某人/系统）无法正常进行；使（某物）无法按预期运作

examples.en: The noise disrupts my concentration.
examples.zh: 噪音会影响我的专注力。

examples.en: Hackers tried to disrupt the company’s network.
examples.zh: 黑客试图破坏公司的网络运作。

extraExplanation: “disrupts”是动词第三人称单数形式（he/she/it disrupts）。原形是“disrupt”。
对比：interrupt 常指“打断（说话/活动）”，强调中途插入；disrupt 更强调“扰乱秩序或流程”，使事情变得不顺畅甚至失控。

summary.en: “Disrupt” means to interrupt or disturb something so it can’t continue normally; “disruption” is the interruption itself.
summary.zh: “disrupt”指扰乱、打断使其无法正常进行；“disruption”指这种中断/扰乱本身。

definition.en: To break up, interrupt, or stop something (a system, activity, or plan) from continuing normally.
definition.zh: 扰乱；打断；使（系统、活动或计划）无法正常进行。

examples.en: The storm disrupted flights across the country.
examples.zh: 暴风雨扰乱了全国范围内的航班。

examples.en: Please don’t disrupt the class while others are speaking.
examples.zh: 别人发言时请不要打断课堂秩序。

definition.en: A sudden interruption or disturbance that prevents something from working or happening normally.
definition.zh: 中断；扰乱；使事情无法正常进行的突发干扰。

examples.en: The company prepared a backup plan in case of a disruption.
examples.zh: 公司为可能发生的中断准备了备用方案。

examples.en: There was a brief disruption in the internet service.
examples.zh: 网络服务出现了短暂中断。

extraExplanation: “disrupt-”来自拉丁语词根，含有“打碎/拆开”的意思，因此这个词常用于“把原本有秩序的流程打乱”。
常见搭配：disrupt the supply chain（扰乱供应链）、disruptive technology（颠覆性技术；能改变行业规则的技术）。注意：disruptive 在商业语境里常带“颠覆、改变格局”的中性/褒义色彩，而 disrupt 通常偏“造成干扰”的中性/负面色彩。
